definition: (onom.) crashing sound
clamor/noise/(bound form) sound used to call cats
crashing sound
(onom.) sound of singing, cheering etc/(phonetic)/(dialect) to chat
sentence-final particle, contraction of 了啊, indicating exclamation/particle placed after each item in a list of examples
(onom.) sound of singing, cheering etc/(phonetic)/(dialect) to chat
sentence-final particle, contraction of 了啊, indicating exclamation/particle placed after each item in a list of examples

sentences.english: The tears are just like raindrops.
sentences.chinese: 嘩啦啦，小白雲的眼淚像雨點。

sentences.english: The rain was pouring through a hole in the roof.
sentences.chinese: 雨水從房頂的漏洞嘩啦啦地流了進來。

sentences.english: The three clung to their seats as bags cascaded down from the luggage racks.
sentences.chinese: 三個人緊緊抓住座位，包從行李架上嘩啦啦落下來。

sentences.english: The rain is pouring in lance-like showers.
sentences.chinese: 大雨嘩啦啦下着，噴水槍似的。

sentences.english: The anchor was instantly dropped, and the chain ran rattling through the port-hole.
sentences.chinese: 錨立刻拋下去了，鐵鏈嘩啦啦一陣響聲過去。

sentences.english: A stream of water went brattling.
Going, and they all climbed up the apple tree.
sentences.chinese: 嘩啦啦，他們全爬上了蘋果樹。

sentences.english: The tree fell with a great crash.
sentences.chinese: 那樹嘩啦啦一聲倒下來。

sentences.english: The rocks crashed down on to the road below.
sentences.chinese: 岩石嘩啦啦滾落到下面的公路上。

a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)
to get soaked

brow beaded with sweat/perspiring freely
to have water get in (one's ear, shoes etc)/to get flooded/inflow of water
lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
lit. to take joy in calamity and delight in disaster (idiom); fig. to rejoice in other people's misfortune/Schadenfreude
to turn over/to surge/to churn/to rummage/raging (torrent)
goose pimples/goose bumps
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
to inconsiderately shout
to tremble/to shake/to shiver
